definition: Beckenham or Beckham (name)/David Beckham (1975-), British midfield footballer
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: The ball he put over at the start of the second half at Hull was like Beckham in his prime.
sentences.chinese: 對赫爾城下半場剛開始他射進的入球像極了貝克漢姆。

sentences.english: And that’s just because he’s married to a Spice Girl.
sentences.chinese: 他們知道貝克漢姆，也僅僅是由於他娶了辣妹。

sentences.english: A serious low for Beckham was at the 1998 World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆的最低谷是在1998年的世界盃。

sentences.english: Backham Earns 47000 Pounds a Day Accounts Reveal.
sentences.chinese: 帳目顯示貝克漢姆日入47000英磅。

sentences.english: David Beckham is a big-timer in the football world.
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆是足球界的大腕。

sentences.english: Beckhan earns 47000 pounds a day accounts reveal.
sentences.chinese: 賬戶顯示貝克漢姆日進47000英鎊。

sentences.english: Representatives of Beckham confirmed he had not made the calls.
sentences.chinese: 經貝克漢姆的經紀人證實，小貝並沒有打這些電話。

sentences.english: Beckham came through the youth system at Old Trafford and made his debut in 1993.
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆出自曼聯青訓營，1993年完成處子秀。

sentences.english: Beckham was not cited or arrested.
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆未被傳訊，也沒有被逮捕。

sentences.english: Beckham Earns 47000 Pounds a Day Accounts Reveal.
sentences.chinese: 帳戶顯示貝克漢姆日入47000英鎊。

sentences.english: The photos show the flossy feelings of "Beckham's night ".
sentences.chinese: 寫真拍出了“貝克漢姆之夜”的迷情效果。

sentences.english: That team might not exist if Beckham had not come to the US.
sentences.chinese: 而如果貝克漢姆沒有來美國，這支球隊甚至不會誕生。

sentences.english: Being with Beckham is a guaranteed good-news story.
sentences.chinese: 和貝克漢姆在一起登出來保證是受歡迎的故事。

sentences.english: Where did it hit Beckham? "Just on the eye." What was the mood like in the changing room after that?
sentences.chinese: 打中了貝克漢姆的什麼位置，“剛好在眼角”。

sentences.english: Addressing Calderón and Mijatovic, Beckham angrily said they had "told lies".
sentences.chinese: 貝克漢姆發表講話說米賈托維奇和卡爾德隆都在說謊。

sentences.english: Perhaps Beckham is heeding Churchill, who had a penchant for pigs.
sentences.chinese: 也許貝克漢姆夫婦留意到邱吉爾也很喜歡豬。

definition: "Becks", nickname of British footballer David Beckham (see 貝克漢姆|贝克汉姆[Bei4 ke4 han4 mu3])
Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres (1780-1867), French Neoclassical painter
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
